017package org.microbean.type;
018
019import java.lang.reflect.Type;
020
021import java.util.AbstractSet;
022import java.util.Arrays;
023import java.util.Collection;
024import java.util.Collections;
025import java.util.Iterator;
026import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
027import java.util.List;
028import java.util.Objects;
029import java.util.Set;
030import java.util.Spliterator;
031import java.util.Spliterators;
032
033import java.util.function.Predicate;
034
035import java.util.stream.Stream;
036
037import org.microbean.development.annotation.Convenience;
038
039import static java.util.Spliterator.DISTINCT;
040import static java.util.Spliterator.IMMUTABLE;
041import static java.util.Spliterator.NONNULL;
042import static java.util.Spliterator.ORDERED;
043import static java.util.Spliterator.SIZED;
044import static java.util.Spliterator.SUBSIZED;
045
046/**
047 * An immutable {@link AbstractSet} of {@link Type}s that ensures that
048 * {@link Type} implementations from different vendors use the same
049 * equality semantics.
050 *
051 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
052 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
053 */
054public final class JavaTypeSet extends AbstractSet<Type> {
055
056
057  /*
058   * Static fields.
059   */
060
061
062  private static final JavaTypeSet EMPTY_JAVA_TYPE_SET = new JavaTypeSet();
063
064
065  /*
066   * Instance fields.
067   */
068
069
070  private final Set<? extends JavaType> set;
071
072  private volatile Type mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType;
073
074  private volatile Type mostSpecializedInterfaceType;
075
076
077  /*
078   * Constructors.
079   */
080
081
082  private JavaTypeSet() {
083    super();
084    this.set = Set.of();
085  }
086
087  private JavaTypeSet(final Type type) {
088    super();
089    this.set = Set.of(JavaType.of(type));
090  }
091
092  private JavaTypeSet(final JavaType javaType) {
093    super();
094    this.set = Set.of(javaType);
095  }
096
097  private JavaTypeSet(final Collection<?> types) {
098    super();
099    final int size = types == null || types.isEmpty() ? 0 : types.size();
100    if (size <= 0) {
101      this.set = Set.of();
102    } else if (size == 1) {
103      final Object o = types instanceof List<?> list ? list.get(0) : types.iterator().next();
104      if (o instanceof JavaType jt) {
105        this.set = Set.of(jt);
106      } else if (o instanceof Type t) {
107        this.set = Set.of(JavaType.of(t));
108      } else {
109        this.set = Set.of();
110      }
111    } else {
112      final Set<JavaType> set = new LinkedHashSet<>(8); // LinkedHashSet is critical for ordering
113      for (final Object type : types) {
114        if (type instanceof JavaType jt) {
115          set.add(jt);
116        } else if (type instanceof Type t) {
117          set.add(JavaType.of(t));
118        }
119      }
120      this.set = Collections.unmodifiableSet(set);
121    }
122  }
123
124
125  /*
126   * Instance methods.
127   */
128
129
130  /**
131   * Returns a new {@link JavaTypeSet} containing only the {@link
132   * Type}s that are not {@linkplain Class#isInterface() interface
133   * types} from this {@link JavaTypeSet}.
134   *
135   * @return a new {@link JavaTypeSet} containing only the {@link
136   * Type}s that are not {@linkplain Class#isInterface() interface
137   * types} from this {@link JavaTypeSet}
138   *
139   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
140   *
141   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
142   *
143   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
144   * threads.
145   */
146  public final JavaTypeSet nonInterfaceTypes() {
147    return new JavaTypeSet(this.set.stream()
148                           .filter(JavaTypeSet::nonInterfaceType)
149                           .toList());
150  }
151
152  /**
153   * Returns a new {@link JavaTypeSet} containing only the {@linkplain
154   * Class#isInterface() interface types} from this {@link
155   * JavaTypeSet}.
156   *
157   * @return a new {@link JavaTypeSet} containing only the {@linkplain
158   * Class#isInterface() interface types} from this {@link
159   * JavaTypeSet}.
160   *
161   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
162   *
163   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
164   *
165   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
166   * threads.
167   */
168  public final JavaTypeSet interfaceTypes() {
169    return new JavaTypeSet(this.set.stream()
170                           .filter(JavaTypeSet::interfaceType)
171                           .toList());
172  }
173

184   *
185   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
186   * threads.
187   */
188  @Override // Set<Type>
189  public final boolean add(final Type type) {
190    throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
191  }

210  }

224    throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
225  }

275   *
276   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
277   * threads.
278   */
279  @Override // Set<Type>
280  public final boolean retainAll(final Collection<?> c) {
281    throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
282  }
283
284  /**
285   * Returns an arbitrarily selected {@link Type} that is guaranteed
286   * to represent the most specialized subclass drawn from the types
287   * in this {@link JavaTypeSet}.
288   *
289   * <p>For example, if a {@link JavaTypeSet} contains {@link
290   * Integer Integer.class}, {@link Number Number.class} and {@link
291   * Object Object.class}, then this method will return {@link Integer
292   * Integer.class}.  If a {@link JavaTypeSet} contains {@link
293   * Integer Integer.class} and {@link String String.class}, then
294   * either {@link Integer Integer.class} or {@link String
295   * String.class} will be returned.</p>
296   *
297   * <p>In practice, most {@link JavaTypeSet}s in normal use
298   * contain classes from a single inheritance hierarchy.</p>
299   *
300   * @return an arbitrarily selected {@link Type} that is guaranteed
301   * to represent the most specialized subclass in its type hierarchy
302   * drawn from the types in this {@link JavaTypeSet}; never {@code
303   * null}; the {@link Type} returned is guaranteed to be either a
304   * {@link Class} or a {@link java.lang.reflect.ParameterizedType}
305   *
306   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
307   *
308   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but deterministic only in
309   * certain cases.
310   *
311   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
312   * threads.
313   *
314   * @see #mostSpecializedInterfaceType()
315   */
316  public final Type mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType() {
317    Type mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType = this.mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType; // volatile read
318    if (mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType == NullType.INSTANCE) {
319      return null;
320    } else if (mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType == null) {
321      mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType = this.mostSpecialized(JavaTypeSet::nonInterfaceType);
322      this.mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType =
323        mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType == null ? NullType.INSTANCE : mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType; // volatile write
324    }
325    return mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType;
326  }
327
328  /**
329   * Returns an arbitrarily selected {@link Type} that is guaranteed
330   * to be a {@link Type} representing the most specialized interface
331   * drawn from types representing interfaces in this {@link
332   * JavaTypeSet}, or {@code null} if this {@link JavaTypeSet}
333   * contains no interfaces.
334   *
335   * <p>The {@link Class} that is represented indirectly by the return
336   * value, if any, is guaranteed to return {@code true} from its
337   * {@link Class#isInterface()} method.</p>
338   *
339   * <p>For example, if a {@link JavaTypeSet} {@linkplain
340   * #contains(Type) contains} {@link java.io.Closeable
341   * Closeable.class} and {@link AutoCloseable AutoCloseable.class},
342   * then this method will return {@link java.io.Closeable
343   * Closeable.class}.  If a {@link JavaTypeSet} {@linkplain
344   * #contains(Type) contains} {@link AutoCloseable
345   * AutoCloseable.class} and {@link java.io.Serializable
346   * Serializable.class}, then either {@link AutoCloseable
347   * AutoCloseable.class} or {@link java.io.Serializable
348   * Serializable.class} will be returned.</p>
349   *
350   * @return an arbitrarily selected {@link Type} that is guaranteed
351   * to be a {@link Type} representing the most specialized interface
352   * drawn from types representing interfaces in this {@link
353   * JavaTypeSet}, or {@code null}; the {@link Type} returned is
354   * guaranteed to be either a {@link Class} or a {@link
355   * java.lang.reflect.ParameterizedType}
356   *
357   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
358   *
359   * @idempotency This method is idempotent but deterministic only in
360   * certain cases.
361   *
362   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
363   * threads.
364   *
365   * @see #mostSpecializedNonInterfaceType()
366   */
367  public final Type mostSpecializedInterfaceType() {
368    Type mostSpecializedInterfaceType = this.mostSpecializedInterfaceType; // volatile read
369    if (mostSpecializedInterfaceType == NullType.INSTANCE) {
370      return null;
371    } else if (mostSpecializedInterfaceType == null) {
372      mostSpecializedInterfaceType = this.mostSpecialized(JavaTypeSet::interfaceType);
373      this.mostSpecializedInterfaceType =
374        mostSpecializedInterfaceType == null ? NullType.INSTANCE : mostSpecializedInterfaceType; // volatile write
375    }
376    return mostSpecializedInterfaceType;
377  }
378
379  private final Type mostSpecialized(final Predicate<? super Type> p) {
380    Type candidate = null;
381    for (final JavaType javaType : this.set) {
382      final Type type = javaType.object();
383      if (candidate == null) {
384        if (p.test(type)) {
385          candidate = type;
386        }
387      } else {
388        for (final Type supertype : JavaTypes.supertypes(type)) {
389          if (p.test(supertype) && this.set.contains(JavaType.of(supertype)) && JavaTypes.supertype(candidate, supertype)) {
390            candidate = supertype;
391          }
392        }
393      }
394    }
395    return candidate;
396  }
397
398  @Override // Set<Type>
399  public final boolean contains(final Object o) {
400    return o instanceof Type t ? this.set.contains(JavaType.of(t)) : this.set.contains(o);
401  }
402
403  @Override // Set<Type>
404  public final boolean isEmpty() {
405    return this.set.isEmpty();
406  }
407
408  @Override // Set<Type>
409  public final int size() {
410    return this.set.size();
411  }
412
413  @Override // Set<Type>
414  public final Iterator<Type> iterator() {
415    if (this.set.isEmpty()) {
416      return Collections.emptyIterator();
417    } else {
418      return new TypeIterator(this.set.iterator());
419    }
420  }
421
422  @Override // Set<Type>
423  public final Stream<Type> stream() {
424    return this.set.stream().map(JavaType::object);
425  }
426
427  @Override // Set<Type>
428  public final Spliterator<Type> spliterator() {
429    if (this.set.isEmpty()) {
430      return Spliterators.emptySpliterator();
431    } else {
432      return
433        Spliterators.spliterator(this.iterator(),
434                                 this.size(),
435                                 DISTINCT | IMMUTABLE | NONNULL | ORDERED | SIZED | SUBSIZED);
436    }
437  }
438
439  @Override // Object
440  public final int hashCode() {
441    return this.set.hashCode();
442  }
443
444  @Override // Object
445  public final boolean equals(final Object other) {
446    if (other == this) {
447      return true;
448    } else if (other != null && this.getClass() == other.getClass()) {
449      return this.set.equals(((JavaTypeSet)other).set);
450    } else {
451      return false;
452    }
453  }
454
455  @Override // Object
456  public final String toString() {
457    return this.set.toString();
458  }
459
460
461  /*
462   * Static methods.
463   */
464
465
466  /**
467   * Returns an {@linkplain #isEmpty() empty} {@link JavaTypeSet}.
468   *
469   * @return an {@linkplain #isEmpty() empty} {@link JavaTypeSet}
470   *
471   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
472   *
473   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
474   *
475   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
476   * threads.
477   */
478  @Convenience
479  public static final JavaTypeSet of() {
480    return EMPTY_JAVA_TYPE_SET;
481  }
482
483  /**
484   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose sole element models the
485   * supplied {@link Type}.
486   *
487   * @param t the {@link Type} in question; must not be {@code
488   * null}
489   *
490   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose sole element models the
491   * supplied {@link Type}; never {@code null}
492   *
493   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
494   *
495   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
496   *
497   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
498   *
499   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
500   * threads.
501   *
502   * @see #of(JavaType)
503   *
504   * @see JavaType#of(Type)
505   */
506  @Convenience
507  public static final JavaTypeSet of(final Type t) {
508    return of(JavaType.of(t));
509  }
510
511  /**
512   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are modeled by the
513   * supplied {@link Type}s.
514   *
515   * @param t0 one of the {@link Type}s in question; must not be
516   * {@code null}
517   *
518   * @param t1 one of the {@link Type}s in question; must not be
519   * {@code null}
520   *
521   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are modeled by the
522   * supplied {@link Type}s; never {@code null}
523   *
524   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
525   *
526   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
527   *
528   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
529   *
530   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
531   * threads.
532   *
533   * @see #of(Collection)
534   *
535   * @see JavaType#of(Type)
536   */
537  @Convenience
538  public static final JavaTypeSet of(final Type t0, final Type t1) {
539    return of(List.of(JavaType.of(t0), JavaType.of(t1)));
540  }
541
542  /**
543   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are modeled by the
544   * supplied {@link Type}s.
545   *
546   * @param types the {@link Type}s in question; must not be {@code
547   * null}
548   *
549   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are modeled by the
550   * supplied {@link Type}s; never {@code null}
551   *
552   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
553   *
554   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
555   *
556   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
557   *
558   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
559   * threads.
560   *
561   * @see #of(Collection)
562   *
563   * @see JavaType#of(Type)
564   */
565  @Convenience
566  public static final JavaTypeSet of(final Type... types) {
567    if (types.length == 0) {
568      return of();
569    }
570    return of(Arrays.asList(types));
571  }
572
573  /**
574   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose sole element is the supplied
575   * {@link JavaType}.
576   *
577   * @param t the {@link JavaType} in question; must not be {@code
578   * null}
579   *
580   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose sole element is the supplied
581   * {@link JavaType}; never {@code null}
582   *
583   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
584   *
585   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
586   *
587   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
588   *
589   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
590   * threads.
591   */
592  public static final JavaTypeSet of(final JavaType t) {
593    return new JavaTypeSet(t);
594  }
595
596  /**
597   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are the supplied
598   * {@link JavaType}s.
599   *

605   *

607   * supplied {@link JavaType}s; never {@code null}
608   *

610   *

612   *

614   *

616   * threads.
617   *
618   * @see #of(Collection)
619   */
620  @Convenience

623  }

625  /**
626   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are modeled by the
627   * supplied {@link JavaType}s.

629   * @param types the {@link JavaType}s in question; must not be
630   * {@code null}
631   *
632   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are modeled by the

634   *
635   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
636   *

638   *
639   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.

642   * threads.

645   */
646  @Convenience
647  public static final JavaTypeSet of(final JavaType... types) {
648    if (types.length == 0) {
649      return of();
650    }
651    return of(Arrays.asList(types));
652  }
653
654  /**
655   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are drawn from the
656   * supplied {@link Collection}, in its {@linkplain
657   * Collection#iterator() iteration order}.
658   *
659   * @param types the {@link Collection} in question; must not be
660   * {@code null}; only its elements that are instances of either
661   * {@link Type} or {@link JavaType} will be considered
662   *
663   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are drawn from the
664   * supplied {@link Collection}, in its {@linkplain
665   * Collection#iterator() iteration order}; never {@code null}
666   *
667   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code types} is {@code null}
668   *
669   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
670   *
671   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
672   *
673   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
674   * threads.
675   */
676  public static final JavaTypeSet of(final Collection<?> types) {
677    return new JavaTypeSet(types);
678  }
679
680  /**
681   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are the {@linkplain
682   * JavaTypes#supertypes(Type) supertypes of the supplied
683   * <code>Type</code>} (which include the supplied {@link Type}
684   * itself).
685   *
686   * @param t the {@link Type} in question; must not be {@code null}
687   *
688   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are the {@linkplain
689   * JavaTypes#supertypes(Type) supertypes of the supplied
690   * <code>Type</code>} (which include the supplied {@link Type}
691   * itself)
692   *
693   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
694   *
695   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
696   *
697   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
698   *
699   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
700   * threads.
701   *
702   * @see #of(Collection)
703   *
704   * @see JavaTypes#supertypes(Type)
705   */
706  @Convenience
707  public static final JavaTypeSet ofSupertypes(final Type t) {
708    return of(JavaTypes.supertypes(t));
709  }
710
711  /**
712   * Returns a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are the {@linkplain
713   * JavaTypes#supertypes(Type) supertypes} of the {@link Type}
714   * modeled by the supplied {@link JavaType} (which include the
715   * modeled {@link Type} itself).
716   *
717   * @param jt the {@link JavaType} in question; must not be {@code
718   * null}
719   *
720   * @return a {@link JavaTypeSet} whose elements are the {@linkplain
721   * JavaTypes#supertypes(Type) supertypes} of the {@link Type}
722   * modeled by the supplied {@link JavaType} (which include the
723   * modeled {@link Type} itself); never {@code null}
724   *
725   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code jt} is {@code null}
726   *
727   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
728   *
729   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
730   *
731   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
732   * threads.
733   *
734   * @see #ofSupertypes(Type)
735   *
736   * @see JavaTypes#supertypes(Type)
737   */
738  @Convenience
739  public static final JavaTypeSet ofSupertypes(final JavaType jt) {
740    return ofSupertypes(jt.type());
741  }
742
743  private static final boolean nonInterfaceType(final JavaType t) {
744    return nonInterfaceType(t.type());
745  }
746
747  private static final boolean nonInterfaceType(final Type t) {
748    final Class<?> c = JavaTypes.erase(t);
749    return c != null && !c.isInterface();
750  }
751
752  private static final boolean interfaceType(final JavaType t) {
753    return interfaceType(t.type());
754  }
755
756  private static final boolean interfaceType(final Type t) {
757    final Class<?> c = JavaTypes.erase(t);
758    return c != null && c.isInterface();
759  }
760
761
762  /*
763   * Inner and nested classes.
764   */
765
766
767  private static final class TypeIterator implements Iterator<Type> {
768
769    private final Iterator<? extends JavaType> i;
770
771    private TypeIterator(final Iterator<? extends JavaType> i) {
772      super();
773      this.i = Objects.requireNonNull(i, "i");
774    }
775
776    @Override // Iterator<Type>
777    public final boolean hasNext() {
778      return this.i.hasNext();
779    }
780
781    @Override // Iterator<Type>
782    public final Type next() {
783      return this.i.next().object();
784    }
785
786    @Override // Iterator<Type>
787    public final void remove() {
788      this.i.remove();
789    }
790
791  }
792
793
794  private static final class NullType implements Type {
795
796    private static final Type INSTANCE = new NullType();
797
798    private NullType() {
799      super();
800    }
801
802  }
803
804}
